chapter.pericope: Jerusalem the Site of God’s Presence

ul.li1: titleA song of ascents. Of David.The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm
1I rejoiced in those who said to me,
“Let us go to the houseOr “temple” of Yahweh.”
2Our feet are standing
within your gates, O Jerusalem—
3Jerusalem that is built
as a city that is joined together,
4where the tribes go up,
the tribes of YahA shortened form of “Yahweh” as a testimony for Israel,
to give thanks to the name of Yahweh.
5For there the thrones sitThat is, rulers or judges on thrones for judgment,
thrones of David’s house.
6PrayHebrew “Ask” for the peace of Jerusalem:
“May those who love you be at ease.
7May peace be within your walls,
security within your palaces.”
8For the sake of my brothers and my friends,
I will say, “Peace be within you.”
9For the sake of the houseOr “temple” of Yahweh our God,
I will seek your good.
